did.head: Records Summary
did.abstract: BU Records: Pi Gamma Mu covers the founding of the Texas Beta Chapter on campus and its 40 years of activity. Papers include correspondence, handbooks and club initiation guides, information on members, and organizational histories.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Pi Gamma Mu is a collegiate honor society for students studying the social sciences. It was founded in 1924 by Dr. Leroy Allen, who was the head of the economics department at Southwestern College in Winfield, Kansas. The organization quickly spread throughout the country and in 1981 it became an international organization with the establishment of a chapter at the University of the Philippines. Pi Gamma Mu has also published a journal since 1925, when it was originally called Social Science. It was changed in 1981 to the International Social Science Review. The organization also supports the studies of members by providing academic scholarships. Currently, there are over 150 chapters in the United States and abroad.

The Texas Beta Chapter of Pi Gamma Mu was charted at Baylor University on 1924 December 1 after Charlie D. Johnson reached out to the society for recognition. Johnson would also become the organization’s first secretary. The organization operated on campus until its dissolution sometime after 1968.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection begins in 1924 and ends in 1968, with some undated materials.The materials detail the day-to-day running of the organization as well club history and rituals through its four decades on Baylor’s campus. There are two series within this collection, entitled Correspondence and Chapter Files. Correspondence contains letters between officers of the Baylor chapter and the national organization. Chapter Files contains materials related to history, events, members, and procedures of the chapter itself. The condition of the collection is good.
Some materials in the collection were compiled by previous Texas Collection staff members over time and kept in subject files. These materials were added to the collection during processing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Prior to current processing, this collection was arranged in no particular order in labeled and unlabeled folders. Currently, the collection is arranged in two series: I. Correspondence, II. Chapter Files.
